architectural_decisions.title: Use Microservices Architecture
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure scalability, maintainability, and security.

architectural_decisions.title: Employ Repository Pattern
architectural_decisions.rationale: To abstract the data access layer and provide CRUD operations.

architectural_decisions.title: Implement Error Handling with Custom Exceptions
architectural_decisions.rationale: To handle various error scenarios effectively.

architectural_decisions.title: Design Data Flow for Order Management
architectural_decisions.rationale: To define clear processes for order creation, retrieval, listing, and cancellation.

architectural_decisions.title: Use ORM for Database Interactions
architectural_decisions.rationale: To simplify database operations and improve code readability.

architectural_decisions.title: Send Confirmation Emails on Order Creation
architectural_decisions.rationale: To notify customers about successful order placement.

Order Management.description: API endpoints for order management in the e-commerce application.

steps.description: Create a new order using POST /api/orders/create endpoint with order items, shipping address, and payment method.
Retrieve order details using GET /api/orders/{order_id} endpoint. Only accessible for the respective user's orders.
List user orders using GET /api/orders/ endpoint with optional limit and offset query parameters.
Cancel a pending order using POST /api/orders/{order_id}/cancel endpoint.
